subNodes.conversationText: There is a set of crumbling stairs here leading up. You can feel a slight breeze on your face. Presumably, the stairs lead to the outside.
You walk slowly up the crumbling steps. They crack and split under your boots, worn with age.

You emerge into the open air. For a moment, you think the sun must have gone down whilst you were in the tomb - there is practically no light here at all. Then you realise that the trees are so closely packed that they blot out the sun.  Their bony branches look sharp and hard.
At the far side of the clearing is a tall, ancient black tree. It was once an oak, but the tangible sense of hatred and malevolence directed at tells you that it is now... something else.

"..... <Race>..."

The voice is in your head. Somehow... the tree is talking to you.

"You have killed my champion. You have tasted my flesh, eaten of me. I offer you power."

You notice the blood red berries hanging from the oak's rotten branches. The berry that you ate from the squirrel's hoard must have come from here.

High in the branches of the tree, you see movement. Squirrels are moving in the branches of the black oak, collecting the small, blood red nuts hanging from its upper branches. They pause and watch you warily..

At the base of the tree, figures are captured in a tangle ancient oak's fat, throbbing roots. You get the feeling that the oak is.... feeding on them. It shifts slightly, and some of its roots retract, revealing a shrivelled human corpse. The corpse slowly gets to its feet, shaking. Its waits at the base of the tree, watching you.
"<Race>..." The voice in your head is seductive, powerful. "I am Kolgoth. I offer you a way out of this forest, with more power than you can imagine."
"You would be my Champion.... in the world. Bringing me the flesh of others. In return, I offer you power beyond your dreams."
"Who... who are you talking to, <FullName>? What's going on?"
"Your friends... trust you. Bring them forward into reach of my roots. That is all you must do. Bring them... forward."
The voice shrieks in your head.
The voice shrieks in your head in rage.
The trees seem to crowd in around you with a fierce pleasure.
"<Race>..." The voice in your head is seductive, powerful. "I am Kolgoth. I offer you a way out of this forest, with more power than you can imagine."
"You would be my Champion.... in the world. Bringing me the flesh of others. In return, I offer you power beyond your dreams."
There is a pause, and you sense that Kolgoth is pleased with you.
"Your friends... trust you. Bring them forward into reach of my roots. That is all you must do. Bring them... forward."
The voice shrieks in your head.
The voice shrieks in your head in rage.
"<Race>..." The voice in your head is seductive, powerful. "I am Kolgoth. I offer you a way out of this forest, with more power than you can imagine."
"You would be my Champion.... in the world. Bringing me the flesh of others. In return, I offer you power beyond your dreams."
"Your friends... trust you. Bring them forward into reach of my roots. That is all you must do. Bring them... forward."
The voice shrieks in your head.
The voice shrieks in your head in rage.
"<Race>..." The voice in your head is seductive, powerful. "I am Kolgoth. I offer you a way out of this forest, with more power than you can imagine."
"You would be my champion.... in the world. Bringing me the flesh of others. In return, I offer you power beyond your dreams."
"Your friends... trust you. Bring them forward into reach of my roots. That is all you must do. Bring them... forward."
The voice shrieks in your head.
The voice shrieks in your head in rage.
There is a set of crumbling stairs here leading up. You can feel a slight breeze on your face. Presumably, the stairs lead to the outside.
You walk slowly up the crumbling steps. They crack and split under your boots, worn with age.

You emerge into the open air. For a moment, you think the sun must have gone down whilst you were in the tomb - there is practically no light here at all. Then you realise that the trees are so closely packed that they blot out the sun.  Their bony branches look sharp and hard.
At the far side of the clearing is a tall, ancient black tree. It was once an oak, but the tangible sense of hatred and malevolence directed at tells you that it is now... something else.
"Kolgoth!" Anu breathes. "The spirit of the ancient wood. This is evil at work."

High in the branches of the tree, you see movement. Squirrels are moving in the branches of the black oak, collecting the small, blood red nuts hanging from its upper branches. They hiss at you angrily.

At the base of the tree, figures are captured in a tangle ancient oak's fat, throbbing roots. You get the feeling that the oak is... feeding on them. It shifts slightly, and some of its roots retract, revealing a shrivelled human corpse. The corpse slowly gets to its feet, shaking. Its eyes fill with hate when it sees you.
"I'm with you. Lets take it down."
There is a set of crumbling stairs here leading up. You can feel a slight breeze on your face. Presumably, the stairs lead to the outside.
You walk slowly up the crumbling steps. They crack and split under your boots, worn with age.

You emerge into the open air. For a moment, you think the sun must have gone down whilst you were in the tomb - there is practically no light here at all. Then you realise that the trees are so closely packed that they blot out the sun.  Their bony branches look sharp and hard.
At the far side of the clearing is a tall, ancient black tree. It was once an oak, but the tangible sense of hatred and malevolence directed at tells you that it is now... something else.
High in the branches, you see movement. Squirrels are moving in the branches of the black oak, collecting the small, blood red nuts hanging from its upper branches. They hiss at you angrily.

At the base of the tree, figures are captured in the oak's fat, throbbing roots. You get the feeling that the oak is... feeding on them. It shifts slightly, and some of its roots retract, revealing a shrivelled human corpse. The corpse gets to its feet slowly, shaking. Its eyes fill with hate when it sees you.
There is a set of crumbling stairs here leading up. You can feel a slight breeze on your face. Presumably, the stairs lead to the outside.
You walk slowly up the crumbling steps. They crack and split under your boots, worn with age.

You emerge into the open air. For a moment, you think the sun must have gone down whilst you were in the tomb - there is practically no light here at all. Then you realise that the trees are so closely packed that they blot out the sun. Their bony branches look sharp and hard.
At the far side of the clearing is a tall, ancient black tree. It was once an oak, but the tangible sense of hatred and malevolence directed at tells you that it is now... something else.
"This is bad! This is bad! This is bad!"

High in the branches of the tree, you see movement. Diseased crows and squirrels are moving in the branches of the black oak. The squirrels are collecting the small, blood red nuts hanging from its upper branches. They hiss at you angrily.

At the base of the tree, figures are captured in a tangle ancient oak's fat, throbbing roots. You get the feeling that the oak is... feeding on them. It shifts slightly, and some of its roots retract, revealing a shrivelled human corpse. The corpse slowly gets to its feet, shaking. Its eyes fill with hate when it sees you.

Ezzbel looks at you, face twisted with a strange mix of sadness and terror.

"There's no way out! We can't get out! We have to kill it!"
"I'm with you, Ezzbel. Lets take it down."
